description: Identify BCGs using sOPTICS and evaluate against Hsu et al. 2022 catalog
instructions:
Apply the sOPTICS algorithm to identify Brightest Cluster Galaxies (BCGs) and evaluate against the Hsu et al. (2022) catalog as described in Section 5.3 of the paper:
1. Apply the optimized sOPTICS algorithm to the NYU-VAGC catalog using the parameters from Task 5
2. For each identified cluster, select the brightest galaxy (lowest r-band magnitude) as the BCG candidate
3. Match the predicted BCGs with the 118 BCGs from the Hsu catalog that were originally part of the Yang et al. (2007) catalog
4. Calculate the recovery rate (number of correctly identified BCGs divided by the total number in the reference sample)
5. Analyze the spatial distribution of both recovered and unrecovered BCGs as shown in Figure 10 of the paper

Return the number of successfully identified BCGs, the overall recovery rate: [number of successfully identified BCGs, overall recovery rate].
